alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 5:16PM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Ohio and Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Carroll, Gallatin, Grant and Owen. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 516 PM EST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Carrollton, Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Vevay, Warsaw, Owenton, Kentucky Speedway, Florence, Patriot, Pleasant, Glencoe, Fairview, Ghent, Sanders, Corinth, Sparta and Worthville.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
